contextId.information: These extremes include everything in between. AT: "all the time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

This refers to men of all levels of wealth and importance. The phrases "are vanity" and "are a lie" have the same meaning. One cannot confidently trust in anyone.  AT: "you cannot place your trust in men, no matter how important they are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: men of low standing ... men of high standing are a lie

contextId.information: The writer uses the words "north" and "south" together to mean that God created everything everywhere. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
These two phrases taken together refer to all possible times of night and day. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This means that Yahweh's love continues forever. AT: "will continue forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This means creatures of all sizes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

This phrase refers to the directions east, where the sun rises, and west, where the sun sets. The writer uses these two extremes to represent everywhere on earth. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:050:001|50:1]]. AT: "Everywhere on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: From the rising of the sun to its setting

contextId.information: The words "heaven" and "earth" represent everything that exists in the physical universe. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
